meanings.definition: To surpass in power or strength.
meanings.sent1: The superhero was able to outpower the villain with his incredible strength.
meanings.sent2: In the race, the cheetah can easily outpower any other animal with its speed.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant managed to outpower the big beetle in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was so strong that it could outpower any obstacle in her way.
meanings.sent5: The roaring lion's presence seemed to outpower all other sounds in the jungle.

meanings.definition: To overcome or defeat in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The underdog team managed to outpower the champions in a thrilling match.
meanings.sent2: Despite the odds, she was able to outpower her fears and give a stellar performance.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox used its wit to outpower the tricky rabbit in the race.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter could outpower any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun's rays seemed to outpower the darkness of the night sky.
